intro: Pasania mucronata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pasania, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with four petals and a tubular corolla. Pasania mucronata is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
